negative.translation[0].definitions[0].e: My drinking was starting to have a negative effect on my work.
On the negative side, it will cost a lot.
negative.translation[0].definitions[1].d: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones
negative.translation[0].definitions[1].e: students with a negative attitude to school
They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
negative.translation[0].definitions[2].e: He gave a negative answer without any explanation.
negative.translation[0].definitions[3].d: containing one of the words ‘no’, ‘not’, ‘nothing’, ‘never’ etc
negative.translation[0].definitions[4].d: not showing any sign of the chemical or medical condition that was being looked for
negative.translation[0].definitions[4].e: A person can be recently infected by HIV and have a negative result.
negative.translation[0].definitions[5].d: a negative charge is carried by electrons
negative.translation[0].definitions[6].e: a negative return on our investment  (=a loss)
negative.translation[0].definitions[7].d: used in the names of blood types, meaning not having the Rhesus factor
negative.translation[1].definitions[0].d: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed
negative.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a statement or expression that means ‘no’
negative.translation[1].definitions[1].e: The majority of people, when asked whether or not they are creative, will reply in the negative.
negative.translation[1].definitions[2].e: The negatives outweigh the positives on this issue.
negative.translation[1].definitions[3].d: a negative result from a chemical or scientific test
negative.translation[1].definitions[3].e: The test will give a proportion of false negatives.
negative.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to refuse to accept a proposal or request
negative.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to prove something to be untrue
negative.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The Bank’s refusal to cut interest rates is having a negative effect on the economy.
negative.translation[3].definitions[2].d: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones
negative.translation[3].definitions[2].e: Stock analysts are growing increasingly negative about general insurance stocks.
negative.translation[3].definitions[3].e: The difference between a positive growth rate of 0.5% and a negative rate of 0.5% is so small the average businessman would be unlikely to feel it.
